Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model with the following properties: - extrude_depth_towards_normal: 0.0194 - extrude_depth_opposite_normal: 0.0 - sketch_scale: 0.75 Part 2 Construct a long, thin, rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. Begin by creating a new coordinate system: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.199, 0.0] Next, create a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system: - Draw a rectangle with the following lines and their respective start and endpoints: - Line 1: [0.0, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0] - Line 2: [0.75, 0.0] to [0.75, 0.0194] - Line 3: [0.75, 0.0194] to [0.0, 0.0194] - Line 4: [0.0, 0.0194] to [0.0, 0.0] Transform the 2D sketch into 3D Sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the coordinate system.
